title: Synchronizing webcal subscriptions
content:
Hi,

I'm using Thunderbird 137. Since Thunderbird 128, CalDAV synchronization has been integrated in Thunderbird, through New Calendar > On my network.

When I try to use this setting (writing https://my-nextcloud-instance.com/ in the Location field), I am only able to add to Thunderbird the calendars I've created on my Nextcloud server. But I've also add webcal subscriptions in this Nextcloud server, and these don't show up.

How do I import webcal subscriptions from a CalDAV cloud calendar in Thunderbird? This should be possible since it was possible with TBSync and is possible on Android with DavX⁵.

title: ukládání příloh
content:
Thunderbird verze 128.10.0esr (64 bitů) na Windows 11

V Nástroje/Nastavení/Soubory a přílohy mám nastaveno: Přenositelný formát dokumentů (PDF) : Uložit soubor Pod tímto rámečkem s volbami pro jednotlivé typy souborů mám ještě nastaveno: Ukládat všechny soubory do složky: C:\Users\...\Dokuments

Přesto se mě Thunderbird neustále ptá, kam má přílohu uložit. Předpokládal jsem, že když u typu souboru v rámečku nastavím "Uložit soubor" a dále zadám cestu, kam se mají soubory ukládat, tak Thunderbird při přijetí zprávy uloží tento typ souboru do uvedené složky. NEDĚLÁ TO! A když kliknu ve zprávě na přílohu, nestane se NIC a když kliknu na tlačítko Uložit, tak se ptá, kam.

TO JE PROSTĚ NELOGICKÉ! CO S TÍM? Děkuji za řešení.
creator: ivo.novak.3

title: Thunderbird Inbox emails gone

I recently posted a request for help which was; Hello, All of a sudden when turning Thunderbird on, I have found that all messages in my Inbox have gone ( except a few for last day or two). Very grateful for any help' Thank you, kindest regards Brian Benger PS where will I get your reply if my email not working??

I had two replies, one was from Wayne Mery who asked what version of Thunderbird I was using, my answer to that was 128.10.0est(64bit). the second message failed to transfer from my mobile to computer because I suspect to my problem above.

So sorry to reply like this I could not find how to reply to very kind replies I received Kindest regards, Sprite (Brian)

title: Thunderbird server settings
content: Hi! I'm assisting some people in installing and setting up Thunderbird. However I notice in the latest version of the software that I can't find where the setting is that allows you to remove messages from the server once downloaded to the client. It looks like this option has either been renamed or removed. Can anyone help? It must be in there somewhere! Thanks for any assistance :-)
creator: webexe

title: Persistent authentication prompt after removing trial email account
content:
Recently, I added a trial email account to Thunderbird. After I stopped using the service, I removed the account. However, something seems to have gone wrong during the removal process. Now, every time I start Thunderbird, I get a pop-up asking for authentication details for `https://dav.mailbox.org`, with Username and Password fields; the host matches the service I removed.

I can’t find any remnants of the account in Account Settings, but the dialog continues to appear seemingly during calendar update cycles. It’s super intrusive and takes hitting ESC/Cancel several times before it vanishes.

I've tried grepping through my Thunderbird profile directory for the URL (and partial matches) but haven’t found any trace of it. I’d really prefer not to recreate my profile from scratch, as I have multiple accounts configured, with some dating back years.

Is there a manual way to remove this lingering reference to the deleted account?
creator: midsbie

title: Sent mail (not sent)
content:
I have been using Thunderbird mail service for over 10 years with a business domain configured to go through google's smtp and imap servers. It is set up on my PC and iphone. Has worked flawlessly. I also have google mail and yahoo mail set up on my iphone. no problems.

This week, I'm having problems with both my thunderbird account (using gmail servers) on my iphone AND on my PC.

On April 28, 2025 I was not able to retreive Thunderbird messages using the mail app on my iphone. I could see all my mail (inbox and sent), but could not retrieve new messages. Small letters at the bottom of my phone said Authentication issues. Yahoo and Google remained working in the mail app on iphone

At home on my PC, I could see all my mail in thunderbird and send and receive messages. I have been on Oauth and I accepted cookies long ago. I am on the most recent version of Thunderbird. And the "place in folder" is configured. I swear I haven't touched a thing in these settings - ever.

Prior to last night, I had a 'sent' and 'sent mail' folder on my PC. 99% of my sent mail was in the "sent Mail" folder. Last night, the "sent mail" folder disappeared. I can now only a "sent" folder and only 47 of some 8000 (estimated) sent emails can be viewed. All of inbox remains fine.

On my iphone, I removed the thunderbird account added it back in to the mail app. the account appears but no messages in the inbox or sent box. When I check the account settings, the imap port is 143. Should I change that?

I do have a saved password in thunderbird on my PC. I've read to delete that saved password and log in again, but now I'm paranoid I'll never get back in.

What is going on? Thank so much for any help. Sue
creator: suepa007

title: Missing mail and several sub-folders in Thunderbird after adding a new account
content:
I added a new account in the latest version of Thunderbird, but not all sub-folders are shown, and some sun-folders failed to include any messages. The account is hosted by Network Solutions, having the following server settings:

IMAP Mail Server Name: netsol-imap-oxcs.hostingplatform.com Port: 993 Outgoing Server Name: netsol-smtp-oxcs.hostingplatform.com Port: 587 User Name: [hidden].com Authentication method: Normal password Connection Security: SSL/TLS

How can I get the missing messages and folders into Thunderbird? Do I need to delete this account and add it back?

Thank you/Steve K.
creator: SJKMB
